title: 'Warmest regards to Putin, Kim as you conspire against US': Trump on China parade
content: Donald Trump criticized China as Beijing held a large military parade attended by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un. Trump claimed American workers sacrificed their lives for China's freedom, urging recognition of their bravery. He then accused Beijing of conspiring against the U.S., sending regards to Putin and Kim.

title: 'Never intimidated by any bullies': Xi flaunts China's might with Putin, Kim Jong Un
content: President Xi Jinping, alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un, showcased China's military might, sending a strong message to the US. Xi affirmed China's rise and warned of a choice between peace and confrontation. Trump responded by accusing the leaders of conspiring against the US, while also highlighting America's support for China during World War II.

title: Gurgaon's night of mayhem: Rs 600 for 6km! Water seige not over
content: Gurgaon was paralyzed by torrential rains, revealing both the city's vulnerabilities and its residents' resilience. Commuters faced flooded roads, exorbitant e-rickshaw fares, and abandoned vehicles. Amidst the chaos, stories of kindness emerged, like a Rapido driver's unwavering patience during a seven-hour traffic jam. While many struggled, some found creative solutions, chartering mini-trucks to navigate the flooded streets.

title: Red alert today: IMD issues warning in J&K, Punjab, Himachal for heavy rain
content: The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for multiple districts across northern India due to continuing heavy rainfall, forecasting flash floods and landslides. Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, and other states experienced significant downpours, with Reasi recording extremely heavy rainfall. Consequently, schools in the Jammu Division will remain closed on September 3rd for safety reasons.

title: Virat Kohli on Bengaluru stampede: 'Nothing prepares you for heartbreak like June 4th'
content: Virat Kohli has addressed the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries, calling it a heartbreaking event following RCB's IPL victory. RCB will provide Rs 25 lakh compensation to the victims' families and establish a memorial. A judicial report held organizers responsible for SOP violations, deeming the venue unsafe.

title: Apple & Samsung to Xiaomi: Stop using our phones; 'Cease and Desist' notice sent
content: Apple and Samsung have reportedly initiated legal action against Xiaomi in India over advertisements that allegedly disparage their products. These ads, comparing Xiaomi's offerings to Apple's iPhones and Samsung's TVs, have sparked concerns about brand value erosion in the competitive Indian market. The legal notices highlight the intense battle for market share in the world's second-largest smartphone arena.

title: UK car crash: 2 Hyderabad students dead, 5 hurt after Ganesh immersion
content: Tragedy struck as two Hyderabad students, Chaitanya Tarre and Rishiteja Rapu, lost their lives in a car collision in Essex, UK, early Monday. The accident, involving two cars carrying nine Indian students returning from a Ganesh idol immersion, left five others injured.

title: 'Was posting reels frequently': Delhi man strangles wife
content: In Delhi's Najafgarh, Aman allegedly killed his wife Rajni due to disagreements over her social media activity. He then tried to commit suicide. Neighbours found Rajni dead and Aman unconscious. Police arrived and took Aman to the hospital. He is now in custody. Rajni had thousands of followers on Instagram. The couple often fought about her online presence.

title: TCS salary hikes: IT giant rolls out 4.5-7% raise to employees; lowest in 4 years
content: Tata Consultancy Services has implemented salary increases for most of its staff, ranging from 4.5-7%, effective September 1, following a five-month delay. These increments, applicable to employees up to grade C3A, coincide with plans to reduce the workforce by approximately 2%.

title: Court blocks Cognizant from using its logo in India - here's why
content: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order and revives an earlier injunction against the IT company. Cognizant faces other legal battles, including disputes with Wipro and Infosys, involving employee poaching and alleged intellectual property violations.

title: 'One year waiting list to meet Premanand ji Maharaj', reveals Raj Kundra
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's devotion to Premanand Ji Maharaj is well-known, and recently Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty also visited him. Raj Kundra, deeply moved by the guru's resilience while undergoing dialysis, pledged to donate a kidney. Despite facing trolls, Kundra remains steadfast in his decision, emphasizing his personal choice and the guru's profound impact.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Why India is to play without sponsor on jersey
content: Team India will participate in the Asia Cup 2025 without a lead sponsor after Dream11 ended its contract due to new online gaming regulations. Consequently, the 'India' logo on the team's jerseys will be more prominent.

title: Trump’s visa curbs shut out Palestinian students and professionals: What’s at stake?
content: Trump’s administration has imposed sweeping visa restrictions on Palestinians, effectively shutting students and professionals out of the US Education, research, medical treatment, and professional exchanges are being blocked, with visas denied even for officials. While framed as national security, critics see it as political, leaving a generation of Palestinians cut off from vital opportunities abroad.

title: ‘I chose a better future’: Youngest female billionaire on why she dropped out of college
content: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.

title: ‘Spinning tales’ in China: Zelenskyy reacts to Putin’s visit
content: President Zelenskyy criticized Putin's visit to China, accusing him of evading responsibility for the war in Ukraine and intensifying air attacks. He highlighted the surge in drone strikes coinciding with Putin's diplomatic efforts and condemned Russia's disregard for international efforts to stop the conflict. Zelenskyy also warned of a buildup of Russian forces and vowed to respond with asymmetrical measures.

title: 30-sec reel helps UP woman locate hubby who 'died' 7 years back; living with 2nd wife
content: In Hardoi, a woman named Sheelu, once accused of her husband's murder, discovered him alive and well in an Instagram reel seven years after his disappearance. Jitendra Kumar, also known as Babloo, was found living a double life in Ludhiana with a second wife. Sheelu's discovery led to Babloo's arrest for bigamy, bringing closure to years of suspicion and hardship.

title: What is the Bronco Test? Why is it bad news for Rohit, Shami?
content: The introduction of the rugby-style Bronco Test in the Indian cricketing system, by the current Indian Strength and Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, has created a lot of buzz. The 2011 World Cup-winning S&C coach Ramji Srinivasan calls it a much-needed step to improve the endurance of the fast bowlers. Meanwhile, Soham Desai, who recently left the Team India set-up, calls it 'just another test'.

title: Cardi B cleared of $24M lawsuit; security guard alleged assault in 2018
content: Cardi B was found not liable in a civil lawsuit brought by a security guard who alleged the rapper assaulted her at a doctor's office in 2018. Emani Ellis claimed Cardi scratched and spat on her during an argument when the rapper was secretly pregnant. Cardi denied touching Ellis, calling the case frivolous and vowing to countersue similar claims.

title: Quota stir: Manoj Jarange ends fast; departing Marathas celebrate with gulal, crackers & selfies
content: Maratha quota supporters in Mumbai celebrated after activist Manoj Jarange declared their battle with the state government over. Celebrations included shouts of victory, gulal, and firecrackers as protesters expressed hope for improved education and job opportunities for their children. Farmers highlighted the struggles of agriculture and the societal pressure for stable employment, while organizers emphasized the desire for equal opportunities.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Ex India player backs Samson ahead of Tilak Varma
content: Mohammad Kaif advocates for Sanju Samson to bat at No.3 in the Asia Cup 2025, ahead of Tilak Varma. Citing Samson's experience and form, Kaif believes he's ideal against Afghanistan, especially facing Rashid Khan. He highlighted Samson's IPL record, South African centuries, and Kerala Cricket League performance.

title: Ranya Rao, 3 others fined Rs 271 crore for smuggling 324 kg gold from Dubai
content: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has issued notices to Sandalwood actress Ranya Rao and three others, imposing a hefty fine of Rs 271 crore for allegedly smuggling 324 kg of gold from Dubai. Ranya Rao, daughter of a senior IPS officer, faces a Rs 102 crore fine.

title: Amit Malviya targets Pawan Khera's wife over 2 voter IDs; drags in Sonia's 1980 entry
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has accused Congress leader Pawan Khera's wife, Kota Neelima, of possessing two active voter IDs. Malviya also targeted Rahul Gandhi for raising voter fraud allegations without due diligence, accusing him of endangering voters by revealing their identities. He further alleged that multiple Congress leaders hold multiple voter IDs, implicating Sonia Gandhi in the controversy.

title: SCO meet: How Modi, Putin, Xi flipped Trump’s tariff gambit - 'reverse Nixon'?
content: At a Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit, leaders from India, China, and Russia displayed a united front, potentially undermining Washington's influence. This convergence, highlighted by warm interactions and strategic agreements, signals a shift in global power dynamics. Putin's strategic positioning aims to strengthen ties with both Beijing and New Delhi, challenging the US's Cold War strategy.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,600; BSE Sensex moves above 80,200
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was near 24,600, BSE Sensex was up over 50 points.

title: Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo chaos: Flyer, crew spar over Har Har Mahadev slogan; flight delayed 3 hrs
content: A Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight faced a significant delay due to a dispute between crew members and a passenger. The crew accused the passenger, a lawyer, of disruptive behavior, including chanting a religious slogan and consuming alcohol on board.

title: Donald Trump’s steel tariffs and immigration policies threaten millions of university jobs
content: While President Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs were hailed as victories for American industry, they overshadowed a far-reaching economic impact on higher education. Universities, employing over three million Americans, face threats from restrictive immigration policies and funding constraints. Policies favoring factories protect relatively few jobs while jeopardizing hundreds of thousands in academia, highlighting a misaligned national priority.

title: 'Should have spoken first': Uthappa admits fallout with Kohli
content: Robin Uthappa revealed that his criticism of Virat Kohli's captaincy, specifically regarding Ambati Rayudu's exclusion from the 2019 World Cup squad, strained their personal relationship. Uthappa admitted he should have discussed his concerns with Kohli privately before making them public. He acknowledged the impact of his comments and learned a valuable lesson about communication within the cricket community.

title: ‘One-sided relationship’: Trump repeats tariff charge on India; cites Harley Davidson
content: US President Trump criticised India’s “tremendous tariffs” on US goods, citing Harley Davidson’s 200% duty. He claimed Indian products faced no such barriers in the US. Highlighting unfair trade, he said Harley built a plant in India to avoid tariffs. Trump plans an “expedited ruling” from the Supreme Court after a lower court deemed many of his tariffs illegal.

title: Endangered knowledge: Why humanities education is losing its footing in America
content: Humanities education, once the intellectual cornerstone of American universities, is facing a historic retreat as programmes are cut, enrolments collapse, and funding models prioritise workforce returns over cultural inquiry. While elite institutions and wealthy donors are preserving liberal arts for the privileged, public universities retreat, raising urgent questions of access, democracy, and the future of intellectual life in America.

title: US Open: Who is Taylor Fritz’s girlfriend Morgan Riddle? Influencer going viral
content: Morgan Riddle, Taylor Fritz's girlfriend, gains attention at the US Open. Her daring stunts and fashion choices go viral. A video of her balancing on a railing sparks conversation. She also wears a New York-inspired outfit. Riddle aims to make tennis cool. Her presence is a talking point. The New York Times calls her famous. She continues to grab headlines.

title: NCR rains: Schools shut in Noida, Ghaziabad amid flood-like conditions; more showers predicted
content: Due to heavy rainfall and flood-like conditions across the NCR, Noida and Ghaziabad authorities have ordered schools to remain closed on Wednesday, September 3, 2025, for students from nursery to Class 12. The order encompasses all schools, including government, aided, CBSE, ICSE, and madrassas.

title: Shilpa Shetty's Bandra restaurant to shut down amid Rs 60 crore fraud case
content: Shilpa Shetty Kundra and Raj Kundra face fraud accusations exceeding Rs 60 crore related to a loan-cum-investment deal. Amidst this controversy, Shilpa Shetty announced the closure of her Mumbai restaurant, Bastian Bandra, with its final day of operation being Thursday. The restaurant, co-owned with Ranjit Bindra, initially opened in 2016 and relocated in 2023.

title: Maratha quota row: Not all of Jarange’s demands accepted by govt; what latest assurance means
content: Manoj Jarange ended his hunger strike after the Maharashtra government conceded to several demands aimed at simplifying the process for Marathas with Kunbi antecedents to obtain OBC certificates. While blanket reservation was deemed legally untenable, the government agreed to implement the Hyderabad gazette and establish village-level committees to facilitate certificate issuance.

title: 'Respect for Nitish Rana has grown': R Ashwin on heated moment with Digvesh Rathi
content: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Digvesh Rathi's display of personality, while praising Rana's handling of media questions after their on-field clash. Rana, who was provoked, responded with aggressive play, leading West Delhi Lions to victory. Both players were penalized for breaching the code of conduct, but Rana's team ultimately won the league championship.

title: ‘Why not step into governor’s shoes?’: SC on bills row; TN seeks timelines
content: In response to Tamil Nadu’s defence of deemed assent for delayed bills, the Supreme Court questioned, “If SC can grant deemed assent... why can't we step into the governor’s shoes?” Singhvi argued governors distort governance by indefinitely delaying bills. The bench cautioned against overreach, stressing constitutional procedure. “We will deal with the Presidential Reference constitutionally,” it said.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Are Suryakumar Yadav’s India undercooked? Big continental test awaits
content: Defending champions India enter the Asia Cup 2025 as favorites, despite a recent lack of T20I match practice. Irfan Pathan believes India's strong NCA system ensures adequate preparation, cautioning them mainly against Afghanistan's potent spinners. He also highlighted Shubman Gill's vice-captaincy as beneficial and revealed Rohit Sharma's desire to continue playing ODIs, contingent on maintaining fitness and game-time.

title: ‘Anxious nights’: Yamuna 1m over danger mark, 10,000 displaced; Ghaziabad, Noida on alert
content: Heavy rainfall and consistent discharge from Haryana's Hathinikund barrage caused the Yamuna River to swell dangerously in Noida and Ghaziabad, prompting the evacuation of over 600 people and 1,400 animals. Authorities are reinforcing embankments and activating relief centers, learning from the devastating 2023 floods.

title: 'Coolie' Box Office collection day 20: Rajinikanth’s action film mints Rs 1.10 crore
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its box office run into its third week. The film experienced a weekend surge in collections. However, weekday earnings saw a decline. 'Coolie' has earned Rs 281.30 crore in India so far. 'War 2', another release, lags behind 'Coolie' in earnings. The film 'Coolie' stars Rajinikanth as Deva, a former union leader.

title: Marathi singer-actor Rahul Deshpande announces divorce from wife Neha after 17 years
content: Marathi singer and actor Rahul Deshpande announced his separation from wife Neha on Instagram after 17 years of marriage. Their legal separation was finalized in September 2024. Rahul emphasized prioritizing their daughter Renuka’s well-being and thanked fans for respecting their privacy during this transition.

title: This over-the-counter nasal spray can reduce your risk of Covid by 67%, new study claims
content: A new study reveals that azelastine nasal spray, an over-the-counter allergy medication, significantly reduces the risk of COVID-19 infection by approximately 67%. Participants in the study who used the spray experienced lower infection rates, milder symptoms, and shorter illness durations. While not a replacement for vaccines or masks, it offers an additional layer of protection during high-risk situations.

title: T20 Tri-Series: Zadran and Atal fire for Afghanistan
content: Ibrahim Zadran and Sediqullah Atal's consecutive half-centuries propelled Afghanistan to an 18-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 tri-series. Afghanistan's spin trio restricted Pakistan to 151 for 9, successfully defending their total of 169 for 5. Despite Mohammad Haris's late flourish, Afghanistan's early dominance with both bat and ball secured the win.

title: 'Entitled ones': PM Modi's jab at Tejashwi, Rahul; 'kaamdaar vs naamdaar' returns before Bihar polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized the RJD and Congress, accusing them of disrespecting his late mother and insulting womanhood during a recent political event in Bihar. Addressing a large gathering of women, he urged them to hold the opposition accountable for their actions and sought their blessings for the upcoming elections.

title: 'I feel bad': Patrick Mahomes' wife Brittany opens up about emotional toll of motherhood
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes and mother of three, recently shared her experiences with the challenges of motherhood. She highlighted the difficulty of balancing personal time with childcare responsibilities and confessed to struggling with mom guilt when accepting help or leaving her children. Despite these struggles, she remains a dedicated supporter of her husband's NFL career.

title: 'Param Sundari' Box Office: Sidharth-Janhvi film picks up on Tuesday; earns over Rs 34 crore
content: Param Sundari witnessed a box office resurgence. The film's domestic collection surpassed Rs 34 crore. The movie had a strong opening weekend, followed by a Monday dip. Tuesday estimates suggest a rise. Overseas, the film earned nearly $1.5 million. The film stars Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor. The movie revolves around a digital romance set in Kerala.

title: Solar storm hits Earth with 21 lakh kmph winds; power grids and satellites on high alert
content: A powerful solar storm, triggered by a rare cannibal CME on August 30, 2025, struck Earth, impacting power grids and satellites. The event, exceeding initial forecasts, caused geomagnetic disturbances and stunning auroras visible at unusually low latitudes. As Solar Cycle 25 peaks, experts warn of increased space weather events, posing risks to technology and daily life.

title: Post IPL retirement plans: R Ashwin eyes shocking BBL debut – talks already underway
content: Ravichandran Ashwin is in talks to potentially become the first high-profile Indian cricketer to play in the Big Bash League. Cricket Australia has approached the veteran off-spinner, who recently retired from the IPL, with Melbourne being a possible destination.

title: Kishtwar floods: What led to the tragedy that claimed 65 lives? Officials share findings
content: A preliminary investigation revealed that dual cloudbursts, not a glacial lake outburst flood, triggered the devastating flash floods in Kishtwar's Chasoti village on August 14, resulting in 65 fatalities. A prior government study had already warned of GLOF risks in vulnerable tehsils like Padder, Machail, Dachhan, Marwah, and Warwan, highlighting their susceptibility to sudden flooding events.

title: "Everything Floats": Shubhanshu Shukla On "Challenges" Of Eating In Space
content: Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to go to the International Space Station (ISS), has shared a glimpse into how astronauts eat and drink in zero gravity, saying he had to "learn to eat again".

title: Lashkar Proxy Behind Pahalgam Got Funding From These Countries
content: India's federal anti-terror probe agency has made a big disclosure on the funding of The Resistance Front, the proxy group of the Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba terror organisation in India, which had claimed responsibility for the Pahalgam attack.

title: "We Get Along With India Very Well, But...": Trump Amid Tariff Tension
content: US President Donald Trump said America gets along with India very well but the relationship was "one-sided" for many years since New Delhi was charging Washington "tremendous tariffs".

title: Google Must Share Search Data With Rivals, Judge Rules in Antitrust Case
content: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered a major makeover of Google's search engine in a crackdown aimed at curbing the corrosive power of an illegal monopoly, but rebuffed the U.S. government's request to break up the company.

title: "No Food In Stomach, Jasmine In Hair": BJP Mocks Karnataka's VIP Aircraft Buy
content: The Karnataka government's decision to buy a helicopter and a private jet for VIP travel has sparked a massive row, with the opposition BJP accusing the Congress government of splurging on luxury when there is no money for development.

title: Government Lifts Cap On Ethanol Production From Molasses, Sugarcane Juice For 2025-26
content: The government on Monday permitted sugar mills and distilleries to produce ethanol without any quantitative restrictions in the 2025-26 marketing year starting November.

title: Trump Announces Relocation Of Space Command, Reverses Biden-Era Decision
content: President Donald Trump announced this afternoon that U.S. Space Command will be relocated from Colorado to Alabama, reversing a Biden-era decision to keep it at its temporary home.

title: Woman, 52, Killed By 26-Year-Old Lover, She Used Instagram Filter To Appear Younger
content: Pressured by a 52-year-old Instagram friend to marry her and return a loan that he had taken from her, a 26-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh allegedly killed her by strangling her with her dupatta.

title: Tianjin Declaration 'Inane', Says P Chidambaram On Pakistan's Endorsement
content: Senior Congress leader P. Chidambaram on Tuesday questioned the credibility of the Tianjin Declaration, which condemned terrorism in all its forms and manifestations, pointing out that the document was signed and adopted by Pakistan as well.

title: Watch: Earphones Fumble Returns To Haunt Shehbaz Sharif During Putin Meet
content: The embarrassment doesn't seem to end for Shehbaz Sharif, the prime minister of Pakistan. He has re-lived a 2022 experience from Uzbekistan, three years during his latest trip to China, with an earphone fumble returning to haunt the Pakistani leader.

title: "Where Are You Today?" Congressman's Tariff Message For Indian Americans
content: A prominent American lawmaker has called out President Donald Trump for "destroying" decades of bipartisan work to build the India-US strategic partnership with his hefty and punitive tariffs on New Delhi.

title: "China Greatest Threat, We Need India To Counter It": Former US Adviser
content: Former US adviser Mary Kissel emphasised India's critical role in the partnership with the country, noting that Washington does need New Delhi's support to counter Beijing's growing influence in the region.

title: Snubbed At SCO, Pakistan PM Makes A "Balancing Act" Remark To Putin
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Tuesday that his country respects Russia's relations with India, as he called for strengthening Islamabad's ties with Moscow during his talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin here.

title: NDA Calls Bihar Bandh On September 4 Over Remarks Against PM Modi, His Mother
content: The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) has announced a statewide bandh in Bihar on September 4 against the opposition over abusive language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother during a joint event in Bihar.

title: Donald Trump Dismisses Rumors He Is In Ill Health, Calls Them "Fake"
content: President Donald Trump on Tuesday dismissed reports on social media that he is in ill health, saying he was busy over the Labor Day weekend giving media interviews and visiting his Virginia golf course.

title: "Peace Or War": Xi Jinping Hosts Massive Military Parade With Putin And Kim
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping warned the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held his country's largest-ever military parade at Tiananmen Square flanked by Russia's Vladimir Putin and North Korea's Kim Jong Un.

title: Andhra Pradesh To Become East Coast Maritime Logistics Gateway: Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday asserted the state's strategic importance as a major maritime hub, highlighting that its ports serve not only its own economy but also the landlocked states like Telangana.

title: Internal Rift In BRS Over Order On CBI Probe Into Kaleshwaram Project
content: The political landscape in Telangana has become a complex web of rivalries and protests, as the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) grapples with internal strife and external pressure from the ruling Congress party.

title: Indrani Mukerjea Left Penniless As Sons Stole Jewellery, 7 Crore, Court Told
content: In setback to prosecution in the Sheena Bora murder case, Vidhie Mukerjea on Tuesday denied in court recording any statement before probe agencies and said that documents annexed as her statement in the CBI's chargesheet were "forged and fabricated."

title: Every Child Has Right To Affection Of Both Parents: Supreme Court
content: Every child has a right to the affection of both parents and even if they live apart or in different countries, it is important for the child to maintain a relationship with them, the Supreme Court said on Tuesday.

title: Let's preview the 2025 NFL season: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Simulating the entire season: The biggest storylines from one possible outcome
content: We played out one of the Football Power Index's 10,000 season sims, from Week 1 through Super Bowl LX.

title: Djokovic spars with US Open crowd, ousts Fritz
content: Novak Djokovic engaged in some back-and-forth with those in the crowd pulling for the last American man in the field as he advanced to a record-extending 53rd Grand Slam semifinal.

title: Valdez denies hitting Astros catcher on purpose
content: Astros starter Framber Valdez said he apologized to catcher Cesar Salazar after hitting him in the chest with a pitch Tuesday night, but the left-hander insisted it wasn't intentional.

title: 3 tossed from Giants-Rockies after Devers homer
content: The Rockies' Kyle Freeland along with the Giants' Matt Chapman and Willy Adames were ejected following a benches-clearing incident that started after Rafael Devers hit a two-run home run.

title: Ohtani belts 100th HR with Dodgers in record time
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 100th home run with the Dodgers in his 294th game with the team, the fastest in franchise history.

title: Hold that, Tiger: Kelly asks if Dabo saw 2nd half
content: After Dabo Swinney gave his grades for Saturday's game -- "they made a 65; we made a 58" -- LSU's Brian Kelly questioned if the Clemson coach saw the second half.

title: Vondrousova injury puts Sabalenka in Open semis
content: Marketa Vondrousova withdrew from the US Open on Tuesday with an injured knee, sending her quarterfinal opponent, Aryna Sabalenka, to the semifinals via walkover.

title: McLean retires last 14, 1st Met to win 1st 4 starts
content: Nolan McLean became the first Mets pitcher to win his first four career starts, retiring the final 14 batters he faced in a 12-5 win over the Tigers on Tuesday.

title: Sanders bites back over Buffs' clock management
content: A feisty Deion Sanders is pushing back against anyone second-guessing his clock management or calling out his coaching staff.

title: 📝 Schefter's cheat sheet: Picks, sleepers to target
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: How the relationship between Micah Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: Which teams will dominate September? Our MLB experts make final-month predictions
content: With less than a month left to play in the 2025 regular season, here's what our experts think will happen the rest of the way.

title: Welcome to September! Ranking the MLB playoff races that will rule the final month
content: Here's what you need to know about the battles to reach October as teams try to lock up a postseason spot.

title: Miami is awesome! Arch isn't! We overreact to Week 1
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: 'Just getting started:' Why Lamar Jackson believes he can take his game to another level
content: Jackson is only a few months removed from one of the best seasons by a quarterback in NFL history, and he still expects to get better.

title: Worst transfers of the window, ranked: From Cunha to Isak, 13 big moves that might fail
content: This summer transfer window had its share of good moves, but we're ranking the 13 worst ones. Did Man United, Liverpool and Arsenal mess up?

title: How did Liverpool afford their $600 million summer of spending?
content: Liverpool won the Premier League title last season but went on a spending spree. Why? And how did they do it?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Top 25 rankings: Every team's top awards candidate
content: From Purdue's Braden Smith to NC State's Will Wade, we're on early awards watch for these candidates from Top 25 teams.

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
content: The long, undistinguished final arc of Dwight Howard's career masks just how high he climbed at his peak.

title: Where the 2025 class stacks up for NBA, WNBA
content: Ahead of enshrinement weekend, let's take a closer look at where this year's class ranks in both leagues.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: College football betting lines: Michigan heads to Oklahoma in ranked showdown
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Michigan-Oklahoma, Arizona State-Mississippi State and every Top 25 matchup.

title: College football betting: Should you bet on Garrett Nussmeier to win the Heisman?
content: As the odds shift each week for the Heisman Trophy, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: How Sam Darnold's one season with the 49ers prepared him for the Seahawks
content: Darnold's long NFL journey has led him to the Seahawks, but his transformative year was spent with thwe 49ers.

title: Buffalo Bills WR Khalil Shakir helps save 19 dogs from being euthanized
content: The Bills wide receiver helped local rescue, Nickel City Canine Rescue, with a transfer of dogs from Clarke County Animal Shelter.

title: How Oscar Piastri changed the fate of McLaren and Alpine
content: Three years ago, a court ruled that Oscar Piastri's move from Alpine to McLaren could go through. Now, he leads the drivers' championship while Alpine is dead last in the constructors'. What changed?

title: Backyard Football '99 re-release date announced for PC and mobile
content: The latest modernized edition of a Backyard Sports game will come to PC, iOS and Android this September.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Barça eye Guéhi after Liverpool deal fails
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid are interested in a pre-contract agreement for Marc Guéhi. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS: Philadelphia jumps San Diego into top spot
content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: 10 big fights that define their careers
content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Karnataka Bhovi Development Corporation Chairperson Ravi Kumar says he will resign in view of allegations of corruption
content: Regarding the video clip that went viral, Mr. Ravi Kumar stated that video clip was doctored and artificial intelligence tools had been used as part of the conspiracy

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE: Five-judge Constitution bench to continue hearing
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai, Justices Vikram Nath and P.S. Narasimha, on September 2, separately remarked that Governors could neither delay the wisdom of the legislature indefinitely nor impede the functioning of the Constitution

title: Rahul urges PM Modi to announce special relief package for flood-affected States
content: In such difficult times, your attention and the active help of the central government are extremely necessary. Thousands of families are struggling to save their homes, lives and loved ones, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: ‘Can’t allow Trump’s ego to destroy strategic relationship with India’: U.S. lawmaker Ro Khanna
content: Khanna explained that PM Modi’s refusal to nominate Donald Trump for a Nobel Peace Prize, while Pakistan did, has led to strained relations

title: Jagan pays tributes to YSR on his death anniversary
content: Later, he visits Duggannagaripalli and interacts with onion and citrus farmers, and slams Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of not providing them minimum support price

title: Additional 53,000 MT urea reaches Andhra Pradesh ports
content: With record allocations, farmers will face no fertiliser shortage during the current kharif and upcoming rabi seasons, say officials

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin arrives in the U.K.
content: Mr. Stalin will address the Self-Respect Movement centenary conference and unveil Periyar’s portrait at University of Oxford

title: CRDA to acquire 1,800 acres in Amaravati for capital development
content: Municipal Administration Minister Narayana appeals to farmers to part with lands under LPS as it fetches them higher long-term benefits than land acquisition

title: How dead birds, old maps are helping scientists track biodiversity loss
content: A new study’s methods highlight the sort of innovation researchers can resort to in order to elicit new ecological and conservation wisdom. While field-based studies remain invaluable to understand the natural history of a habitat or species, data collected decades ago provides historical context to current biodiversity baselines

title: When a historic election in 1977 turned Tamil Nadu political landscape bipolar
content: The year has always been a source of attraction to many in Tamil Nadu, be they from politics or the cinema. Actor Vijay’s Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), which is planning to enter the electoral fray in 2026, has been fancying 1977, apart from 1967.

title: SC orders DISCOMs to clear their regulatory assets | Explained
content: If the regulatory assets reported by DISCOMs operating in Delhi are to be recovered within the four-year window set by the apex court, they need to recover about Rs 16,580 crore a year

title: When Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Annadurai enthralled students at Yale University
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin is scheduled to deliver address at the University of Oxford in the United Kingdom to mark the centenary of the Self-Respect Movement on September 4, 2025

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes appointment of 26 new judges to Allahabad High Court
content: The Collegium, in two separate proposals, has recommended 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, the latter batch of which include two senior women lawyers from the Supreme Court Bar

title: J&K Opposition parties express dismay over constructing Police Martyrs’ building on 70-year-old playground in Srinagar
content: PDP leader and Pulwama MLA Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra said the land for the Police Martyrs’ building has been a playground for 70 years; JKAP president Syed Altaf Bukhari termed the police’s move as “deeply concerning”

title: U.P. government orders probe into lathi charge on ABVP activists in Barabanki, CO removed
content: The incident happened on Monday (September 1, 2025) when ABVP workers and students staged a protest at the Shri Ram Swaroop Memorial University in Barabanki, alleging that the university is accepting admissions in LLB course even after its recognition was cancelled

title: Behind Maratha quota issue resolution, a climbdown by both the Mahayuti government and the activist
content: Over the last few days, the Cabinet subcommittee on Maratha reservation held four meetings. Drafts for the orders were kept ready, but the government maintained that it was firm on finding a constitutional solution to the deadlock

title: Hyderabad launches cyber innovation hub to strengthen digital security
content: The initiative, housed within IIIT Hyderabad campus, spans more than 3,000 square feet and is equipped with specialised tools and infrastructure dedicated to cybersecurity

title: Consumer Commission comes down heavily on LIC
content: The bench strongly criticised LIC for attempting to repudiate claims while being willing to issue policies to vulnerable clients

title: Student anger spills over as SFI stages protests over pending fee reimbursement
content: According to SFI State committee, the State government owes ₹8,158 crore dues towards RTF in the past six years

title: 27 villages declared ‘sensitive’ in Faridabad as Yamuna water rises
content: Residents of a few villages have already shifted to safer locations identified by the authorities after floodwaters entered their homes.

title: Faridabad Deputy Commissioner visits ‘sensitive’ villages, urges residents to shift to safe homes due to rising water levels
content: Deputy Commissioner Vikram Singh visited the sensitive villages to take stock of the situation and made an appeal to the villagers to shift to the safe homes built by the administration in time

title: Disciplinary action initiated against 94 Excise officials for dereliction of duty
content: A digital system was being implemented in the Department, and permission has been given to renew the license online once every 5 years: Minister

title: Karnataka High Court stays NMC’s action; permits admission for MBBS course in Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College in Belagavi for 2025-26
content: THe High Court of Karnataka has stayed the National Medical Commission’s decision of not permitting students to the first-year MBBS course for 2025-26 in the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belagavi, based on bribery allegations

title: BJP delegation asks BC commission to drop Christian sub-castes listed for survey in Karnataka
content: The BJP urged the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, headed by Madhusudan R. Naik, to drop Christian ‘sub castes’ listed in the draft list of castes ahead of the socio-educational survey of the State population

title: Madras High Court reserves orders on Devanathan Yadav’s bail plea in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund Nidhi Ltd case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran wonders how the finance company will recover dues from its borrowers if EOW keeps it sealed for over one year

title: Army Vehicle intercepted by Kolkata Police for reckless driving
content: The incident occurred at about 11 a.m. on Tuesday (September 2, 2025) and the military truck was stopped by Kolkata Police after it came close to the vehicle of Kolkata Police Commissioner Manoj Kumar Verma

title: Bihar Cabinet approves plan to open seven medical colleges across seven districts
content: Bihar Cabinet sanctions ₹20,000 crore to roll out Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, approves the creation of 3,233 posts in different government departments, among other major decisions

title: Arundhati Roy’s memoir Mother Mary Comes to Me launched in Kochi
content: The event saw discussions on her new book, how it came to be, and touched on the childhood events that shaped the writer.

title: CBI arrests two persons in ‘reverse trap’ case
content: “In a commendable act of integrity, the Superintendent in GST Intelligence played a pivotal role in the CBI operation that led to the arrest of two private individuals on bribery charge,” a CBI official said

title: West Bengal Assembly debates harassment on Bengali speaking migrants in other States
content: Minister Chandrima Bhattacharya said that the national anthem is written in Bengali and no person in the country can deny that

title: West Bengal LOP suspended from Assembly for creating ruckus in the House
content: Suvendu Adhikari raised objections to a remark by State’s Education Minister Bratya Basu directed at Army during a debate in the House

title: Governors cannot sit over Bills endlessly, say Supreme Court judges
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justices Vikram Nath and P.S. Narasimha separately remark that Governors could neither delay the wisdom of the legislature indefinitely nor impede the functioning of the Constitution; Tamil Nadu and West Bengal seek collaboration, not combat, among high offices

title: BJP’s women leaders slam Opposition over insults to Modi’s mother
content: The pain felt by the PM is also being perceived by the people of Bihar and the entire country, says Nirmala Sitharaman, demanding an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and RJD’s Tejashwi Yadav

title: Singapore Prime Minister begins 3-day visit to India
content: Lawrence Wong will hold talks with Modi, Jaishankar, Pradhan; External Affairs Ministry says the visit will provide an opportunity to review the robust relation between the two countries

title: Foreigners Tribunals can issue arrest warrants, send ‘foreigners’ to detention centres
content: A new order gives Foreigners Tribunals powers of a first class judicial magistrate; it bars foreigners from taking jobs in the fields of defence, nuclear energy and human rights

title: COP-30 to focus on known solutions, says its President
content: The UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) will hold its 30th Conference of Parties (COP-30) in November, in the Brazilian port city of Belem, a gateway to the Amazonian rainforest.

title: Hindus should avoid Halal meat to protect Sanatana Dharma: Giriraj Singh
content: Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) asks Union Minister to speak on jobs instead of lecturing people on food habits

title: Sasikanth Senthil says he is not after the post of Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president
content: The Tiruvallur MP says that he decided to end the protest because he managed to highlight the issue of non-disbursal of  funds under Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan to Tamil Nadu and a few other States

title: J&K parties unhappy over ‘denial of protocol’ to CM Omar Abdullah during Amit Shah’s Jammu visit
content: The statements of the political parties came after several pictures went viral on social media and attracted the attention of netizens

title: Madras High Court appoints one-man commission to probe alleged police excess while quelling Chennai conservancy workers’ protest
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan request retired judge V. Parthiban to act as a one-man commission and submit a report as expeditiously as possible

title: Steamrolling ethanol-blended petrol puts seasoned mechanic, customers in trouble
content: Use of ethanol-blended petrol (E-20) is causing mechanical issues in the functioning of fuel system, including carburettor and engine, of vehicles

title: CPI State-level conference passes 11 resolutions
content: The party urges the State Election Commission to conduct polls to local bodies every five years without fail

title: Govt. issues notification for buffer zones around drains in Bengaluru
content: For primary drains, the buffer zone should be 15 mm on either side from the edge of the drain/nala, for secondary and tertiary drains, it is 10 mm and 5 mm respectively

title: Government’s Onam season spending to cross ₹20,000 crore
content: Government is spending ₹12,100 crore on salaries and pensions, Onam bonus and festival allowance, Onam advance, DA and dearness relief, benefitting over 13 lakh government employees, workers and pensioners, according to Finance Minister

title: Now it is Kavitha, but in 2013, Vijayashanti faced the same treatment from KCR

title: Chief Minister to open State-level Onam Week celebrations on Wednesday

title: Tamil Nadu secures 23 more deals in Germany worth more than ₹3,800 crore

title: NMC approves additional 450 medical seats in Karnataka medical colleges
content: Out of this, NMC has given approval to increase 400 medical seats in eight government medical colleges

title: India, Thailand Armies begin joint exercise in Meghalaya
content: Aimed at enhancing interoperability and mutual understanding, the exercise is part of the ongoing military-to-military exchange programme between the two nations

title: Angel Reese appears in feature film 'A House of Dynamite' alongside Idris Elba

title: A'ja Wilson, Kelsey Plum highlight additions to NBA 2K26 Season 1

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: in a single sentence, it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . early in the season, ratings are based primarily on preseason projections .

title: Stafford embarking on Year 17, will he -- and his back -- make the most of it?
content: quarterback's back soreness isn't impacting his expectations for the Rams, coach says . he is entering his fifth season in los angeles . the team is hoping to host the Houston Texans to open the season on sunday .

title: Fantasy Football Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material . your league, your rules Create a league and customize league size, scoring and rules to play . if you play in a redraft league, an intense deep dynasty format or anything in between, we at ESPN Fantasy are here to help .

title: Expectations dashed, Manning and Belichick need to rebuild
content: quarterbacks Peyton and Eli Manning won 10 of the 18 Super Bowls from 2001-2019 . belichick, 73, was trying to reinvent himself as a college coach at north Carolina . he was set to take over at Texas as the next generation of the family business, quarterbacking .
